original_text: Though, in this Letter we have constructed the Born–Infeld black holes in the presence of a cosmological constant and discussed their thermodynamical properties, many issues however still remain to be investigated. We know that Reissner–Nordström AdS black holes undergo Hawking–Page phase transition. This transition gets modified as we include Born–Infeld corrections into account. We hope to carry out a detail study on this issue in the future. Furthermore, in the context of brane world cosmology, it was found that a brane moving in a Reissner–Nordström AdS background generates non-singular cosmology [14]. However, as shown in [15], the brane always crosses the inner horizon of the bulk geometry, creating an instability. It would be interesting to study cosmology on the brane when it is moving in the charged black hole backgrounds that we have constructed. Note that since these charged holes does not have inner horizon for certain range of parameters, we may generate non-singular cosmology without creating the instabilities that we have just mentioned.
original_translation: Sin embargo, en esta carta hemos construido los agujeros negros de Born-Infeld en presencia de una constante cosmológica y discutido sus propiedades termodinámicas, aún quedan muchos problemas por investigar. Sabemos que los agujeros negros de Reissner-Nordström AdS experimentan una transición de fase de Hawking-Page. Esta transición se modifica al incluir correcciones de Born-Infeld en cuenta. Esperamos llevar a cabo un estudio detallado sobre este tema en el futuro. Además, en el contexto de la cosmología del mundo de branas, se encontró que una brana moviéndose en un fondo de Reissner-Nordström AdS genera una cosmología no singular [14]. Sin embargo, como se muestra en [15], la brana siempre cruza el horizonte interno de la geometría del volumen, creando una inestabilidad. Sería interesante estudiar la cosmología en la brana cuando se está moviendo en los fondos de agujeros negros cargados que hemos construido. Ten en cuenta que, dado que estos agujeros cargados no tienen un horizonte interno para cierto rango de parámetros, podríamos generar una cosmología no singular sin crear las inestabilidades que acabamos de mencionar.

We know that Reissner–Nordström AdS black holes undergo Hawking–Page phase transition.
This transition gets modified as we include Born–Infeld corrections into account.
We hope to carry out a detail study on this issue in the future.
Furthermore, in the context of brane world cosmology, it was found that a brane moving in a Reissner–Nordström AdS background generates non-singular cosmology [14].
However, as shown in [15], the brane always crosses the inner horizon of the bulk geometry, creating an instability.
It would be interesting to study cosmology on the brane when it is moving in the charged black hole backgrounds that we have constructed.
Note that since these charged holes does not have inner horizon for certain range of parameters, we may generate non-singular cosmology without creating the instabilities that we have just mentioned.

original_annotated_sentences:
Though, in this Letter we have
constructed the Born–Infeld black holes in the presence of a cosmological constant
and discussed their thermodynamical properties, many issues however still remain to be investigated.
We know that Reissner–Nordström AdS black holes undergo Hawking–Page phase transition.
This transition gets modified as we include Born–Infeld corrections into account.
We hope to carry out a detail study on this issue in the future.
Furthermore, in the context of brane world cosmology, it was found that a brane moving in a Reissner–Nordström AdS background generates non-singular cosmology [14].
However, as shown in [15], the brane always crosses the inner horizon of the bulk geometry, creating an instability.
It would be interesting to study cosmology on the brane when it is moving in the charged black hole backgrounds that we have constructed.
Note that since these charged holes does not have inner horizon for certain range of parameters, we may generate non-singular cosmology without creating the instabilities that we have just mentioned.

Output: Aunque, en esta Carta hemos construido los agujeros negros de Born-Infeld en presencia de una constante cosmológica y
discutido sus propiedades termodinámicas
, aún quedan muchos problemas por investigar. Sabemos que los agujeros negros de Reissner-Nordström AdS experimentan una transición de fase de Hawking-Page. Esta transición se modifica al incluir correcciones de Born-Infeld en cuenta. Esperamos llevar a cabo un estudio detallado sobre este tema en el futuro. Además, en el contexto de la cosmología del mundo de branas, se encontró que una brana moviéndose en un fondo de Reissner-Nordström AdS genera una cosmología no singular [14]. Sin embargo, como se muestra en [15], la brana siempre cruza el horizonte interno de la geometría del volumen, creando una inestabilidad. Sería interesante estudiar la cosmología en la brana cuando se está moviendo en los fondos de agujeros negros cargados que hemos construido. Ten en cuenta que, dado que estos agujeros cargados no tienen un horizonte interno para cierto rango de parámetros, podríamos generar una cosmología no singular sin crear las inestabilidades que acabamos de mencionar.

generate non-singular cosmology without.translated_key: generar una cosmología no singular sin crear las inestabilidades
original_annotated_sentences: Though, in this Letter we have constructed the Born–Infeld black holes in the presence of a cosmological constant and discussed their thermodynamical properties, many issues however still remain to be investigated.
We know that Reissner–Nordström AdS black holes undergo Hawking–Page phase transition.
This transition gets modified as we include Born–Infeld corrections into account.
We hope to carry out a detail study on this issue in the future.
Furthermore, in the context of brane world cosmology, it was found that a brane moving in a Reissner–Nordström AdS background generates non-singular cosmology [14].
However, as shown in [15], the brane always crosses the inner horizon of the bulk geometry, creating an instability.
It would be interesting to study cosmology on the brane when it is moving in the charged black hole backgrounds that we have constructed.

Note that since these charged holes does not have inner horizon for certain range of parameters, we may
generate non-singular cosmology without creating the instabilities
that we have just mentioned.

generate non-singular cosmology without creating the instabilities
that we have just mentioned.

generar una cosmología no singular sin crear las inestabilidades
que acabamos de mencionar.
